net.cloud.gfx

Class CloudGfx

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.CloudGfx
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShutdownService

    public class CloudGfx
extends java.lang.Object
implements ShutdownService
    A facade of sorts to the.. erm.. CloudGfx system. Contains the underlying objects necessary for the system, including the thread that drawing is done on, the panel containing the UI, and the shutdown hook to stop the thing.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private DrawLogic drawLogic
      The object that will make drawing happen [regularly]
      private java.lang.Thread drawThread
      The thread that the draw logic will be running on
      private RootPanel rootPanel
      The JPanel that will draw the graphics hierarchy
      private ShutdownHook shutdownHook
      The hook that will stop drawing activity

    • Constructor Detail

      • CloudGfx

        public CloudGfx(int width,
                int height)
        Create a new graphics hierarchy, which can be embedded in an application. This will act as a facade and central access point. The graphics will initially be the desired dimensions.
        Drawing will not start after creation, a call to startDrawing() is needed.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the panel to create
        height - The height of the panel to create

    • Method Detail

      • getShutdownHook

        public ShutdownHook getShutdownHook()
                             throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Obtain a shutdown hook which can be used to stop the graphics from being redrawn. Available after construction.
        Specified by:
        getShutdownHook in interface ShutdownService
        Returns:
        The hook to stop the graphics loop
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the hook is not available

      • rootPanel

        public RootPanel rootPanel()
        Returns:
        The RootPanel storing the game graphics

      • getdrawlogic

        public DrawLogic getdrawlogic()

      • startDrawing

        public void startDrawing()
        Start the graphics being drawn. This will start the drawing thread and it will loop until stopped via the shutdown hook.
